alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 31 at 3:16AM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Elko has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Nevada... Marys River Near Deeth affecting Elko County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt high mountain snowpack and keep river flows elevated. For the Marys River...including Deeth...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Marys River Near Deeth. * WHEN...From early this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 5.5 feet, This is monitoring stage or about 365 cfs. No flooding occurs within the reach. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:15 AM PDT Wednesday the stage was 5.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 5.9 feet early this morning. - Action stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 100 PM PDT.
